summary: Bruce Cheever was the former deputy director of Task Force W, a group involved in the Mongoose operation. An interview summary from July 24, 1975, details Cheever's discussion with Paul Wallach and Joe DiGenova regarding the assassination inquiry. He spoke about Task Force W's role in Operation Mongoose and his interactions with individuals such as Harvey, Lansdale, and members of the SGA. Other documents, including index cards and minutes of Special Group meetings, indirectly relate to the context of Cheever's work within the CIA concerning covert operations and assassination plots against Fidel Castro. The documents span from 1964 to 1976, reflecting the period of Cheever's involvement and subsequent inquiries.
significance: Bruce Cheever's significance in the JFK context lies in his role as the former deputy director of Task Force W, which was involved in Operation Mongoose, a covert operation targeting Fidel Castro. His involvement and knowledge of these activities made him a subject of interest during the assassination inquiry, as evidenced by the interview conducted with him.
